subject: Self Care
title: When Habits Need to Change
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on When Habits Need to Change.

hook.text: A habit that served you at 25 might harm you at 45. Good habits can become outdated. Review them regularly.

buildup.text: Life changes â€” new jobs, health shifts, family growth â€” require habit audits. What worked before may not fit.

discovery.text: An annual habit review evaluates what's working, what's not, and what needs updating for the season ahead.

twist.text: Clinging to habits because they worked before is its own trap. Flexibility is as important as consistency.

climax.text: Schedule a quarterly check-in. Ask: does this habit still serve who I am becoming? If not, evolve it.

punchline.text: Good habits evolve. Review and adapt regularly.

quiz.question: Why should habits be reviewed periodically?
options: Life changes require habit audits to stay relevant
